column4: How?
shift page up
you can still scroll up
Should I have linux-image installed?
dpkg -l | grep linux
That flows way out of my screen (no x seeing nvidia doe not work)
but pipe it through less.   dpke -l | grep 'linux-image' | less
Nice :)  I have worked for years not knowing how to scroll!
i live in the console, hardly start x at all.   so less is a must.
Hmm what do you do for web browsing?
elinks
I see, I have used elinks from time to time but always find it lacking (probibly because I have never learned all the keyboard commands) :)
there is also links2 which supports graphics, lynx w3m, or one can wget <url.here> | html2text | fold -s | less      # hehhe why use a web browser at all....  :)

Mostly I use it to work with my gateway away from home hence the need for a browser so I can log in.  Do you happen to know where grubs menu is stored nowdays?  I looked in /boot but there is no grub?
After spending all that time on the command line you don`t know a magic little command to do that?
never plaied there before
You could always write a simple script to do it
i can probably cludge togather something with  while read ;do
They always have a space?  I could write one in perl pretty quick if I had my xserver back...  I like my mouse!
i was hoping some knew a secret tho
yes always a space for "IFS"
Hmm, that would be pretty easy to do then
i think i have it with awk.  thanks tho
See I knew you had the magic in you with al the command line time :)
